item.title: Connect to Docker containers
item.description: While using docker, we ocasionally have to connect to another Docker container such as mysql. In this case, we have to use Docker --network flag. Although Docker provided --link flag before 1.9.0 version, this flag is a deprecated legacy feature according to Legacy container links. This document shows how to declare Docker network using --network flag. $ docker network create tikahost $ docker run -d -p 9998:9998 --name tika --network tikahost logicalspark/docker-tikaserver $ docker run --name daumlab -p 8888:8888 -v '/home/vagrant/Project/daum/scrapy:/home/jovyan/work' -d --network tikahost newsmine:latest After declaring Docker network, containers can be connected using their Docker name.
